revised_title: Investigations into the Formation of Ground Gru and its Relation to Hoar-Frost and Dew
tldr: The author, James Farquharson, investigates the formation of ground gru, a unique type of ice that forms at the bottom of running water under specific conditions. He compares the phenomenon to the formation of hoar-frost and dew on land, explaining that the main difference is the presence of water above the ice. Farquharson also addresses objections to his explanation and provides further evidence for his theory.
